title: What Color Neutralizes Red Tones in Hair? How to Cancel Out Red Hair Dye

steps.title: Green is definitely the best color to cancel out red hair.
steps.content: Green is definitely the best color to cancel out red hair. [1] X Expert Source Kelsey Morey Professional Hair and Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 11 January 2022. Because it’s the opposite of red, green neutralizes it. Green is also a cooling shade, so applying it on top of red tones will either tone down or completely get rid of their warmth. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Use a toning shampoo with cool colors.
steps.content: Use a toning shampoo with cool colors. Green, blue-green, and violet all tone down the warmth in your hair, but they’re each used for different kinds of red undertones. Green shampoos are used for red tones in medium or dark brown hair. [3] X Expert Source Kelsey Morey Professional Hair and Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 11 January 2022. Blue-green, or ash, shampoos are best to tone down red-orange tones in brunette or natural red hair. Violet shampoos reduce red-orange tones in blond hair. Dyed or undyed brunette hair warms up over time, ending up with plenty of red tones. The green in toning shampoo and conditioner will target the unwanted red. Blond hair can get red-orange from too much heat or from adding too many warm pigments to it. You can use violet toning shampoo to tone down all the red-orange warmth. Natural red hair is usually a combination of red and orange. The blue-green color in ash toning shampoos targets both of these shades and helps cool down its warmth.

steps.title: Apply violet-toned shampoo and avoid heat as much as you can.
steps.content: Apply violet-toned shampoo and avoid heat as much as you can. Brassiness is just warm orange-red tones in your hair, and you can cancel them out with the coolness of violet. Too much sun, blow drying, or warm colors from a dye can all add red-orange to your hair. You’ll get the best results from violet toning shampoos if you can also cut down on any heat exposure. If you bleached your hair, wait 2 weeks before toning it. [4] X Research source Bleached hair is fragile, so you should be extra careful around heat. Since toning shampoos usually have ammonia, they can break newly bleached locks.

steps.title: You can cool its red-orange tones with blue-green toning shampoo.
steps.content: You can cool its red-orange tones with blue-green toning shampoo. Ash toning shampoos will neutralize the different kinds of warmth in your hair. [5] X Research source Blue-green is sometimes called a “calm” color because it cools down a wide range of red pigments.

steps.title: Use toning shampoo once or twice a week.
steps.content: Use toning shampoo once or twice a week. Maintaining a routine with the right toning shampoo will make sure you keep cooling down hints of red or orange. Leave your toning shampoo on for around 2-3 minutes with each treatment. Then, use a matching toning conditioner so you can moisturize your hair . [6] X Research source You can also use a green hair mask. This technique lets the red canceling blend sit on your hair for a long time, boosting its neutralizing effects. Regularly color-correcting your hair will save you from frequently going to the salon.

steps.title: You can create your own toning shampoo with food dye.
steps.content: You can create your own toning shampoo with food dye. If you want to save some money or have a set of shampoo and conditioner you really like, put 2 drops of food dye into the conditioner. Green food dye works for toning down red or orange in dark hair. Purple food dye cools red-orange in blond hair. Blue-green food dye reduces hints of red-orange in medium hair colors like brown or auburn. [7] X Research source Wear gloves to keep from staining your hands with food dye. Your shampoo doesn’t need any green food dye, and you can just use it like you normally do. Keep the doctored conditioner on for 10-12 minutes, then rinse with cool water. If you’re a natural redhead and blue-green food dye isn’t toning your hair enough, try a home remedy of vinegar and crushed vitamin C tablets. Apply it to your hair, put on a shower cap, and let it sit for 10 minutes. The natural acids will tone down warm red-orange pigments. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Your best bet is to dye it an opposite color.
steps.content: Your best bet is to dye it an opposite color. Because dyes are stronger than red tints or tones, you’ll need another dye that’s just as powerful to offset the one you don’t want anymore. Green or cool ash dye will cancel out hair that’s dyed red. If your dyed hair is on the warm orange side, use a completely blue hair dye. [9] X Research source If your hair dye is a true red, then a green dye will be the most effective. Warm orange-red brassy tones can be darkened with brunette dye or lightened with blonde dye. An ash dye will cancel out any kind of warmth in your hair. You can use it if your red dye also has too many yellow or orange tones in it.

steps.title: Try toning your hair first to avoid damage.
steps.content: Try toning your hair first to avoid damage. Bleach is definitely known for getting rid of color, but it can also really damage your hair. Usually, red pigments can be color corrected by letting a toner stay on your hair for up to half an hour. That way, the canceling shade can soak into your hair and cool the warmth down with way more dramatic results. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Usually, it’s because your hair is absorbing a lot of heat.
steps.content: Usually, it’s because your hair is absorbing a lot of heat. Heat styling your hair or even just walking in the sun a lot can both lead to red undertones. Your hair might also just naturally have red undertones, and during different times of the year and it lightens, these will be more obvious. [11] X Research source Hard water can also redden your hair. If you’re worried about this, you can soak your shower head in white vinegar overnight, scrub it, rinse it, and put it back.
